sen.j: 三善 康信（みよし の やすのぶ、保延6年（1140年）- 承久3年8月9日 (旧暦)（1221年8月27日））は、平安時代末期、鎌倉時代初期の公家。
sen.e: Yasunobu MIYOSHI (1140-August 27, 1221) was a court noble who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of Kamakura period.
MIYOSHI no Yasunobu (also known as Yasunobu MIYOSHI) (1140 - September 3, 1221) was a court noble who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 原文の読みに合わせ、一般的と思われる別の読みを補足しました。グレゴリオ暦に直しました。
sen.e: MIYOSHI no Yasunobu (also known as Yasunobu MIYOSHI) (1140 - September 3, 1221) was a court noble who lived from the end of the Heian period to the beginning of Kamakura period.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の初代問注所執事。
sen.e: He was the first director of Monchujo (an organization in charge of administering lawsuits) during the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 入道の後は善信（ぜんしん）という法名を名乗る。
sen.e: When he became a monk, he took the name Zenshin.

Yasutsura MIYOSHI is one of his sons.

sen.e: Yasutsura MIYOSHI was one of his children.

sen.j: 元々は太政官の書記官役を世襲する下級貴族で、算道の家柄の出身。
sen.e: He originally comes from a family of lower-ranking nobility that inherited the post of secretary of the political bureaucracy and the family was in charge of mathematics.
He originally came from a family of lower-ranking nobility that inherited the post of secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and the family was in charge of mathematics.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: He originally came from a family of lower-ranking nobility that inherited the post of secretary of Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and the family was in charge of mathematics.

sen.j: 父は三善康光、または康久とされる。
sen.e: His father was Yoshimitsu or Yoshihisa MIYOSHI.
His father was Yasumitsu MIYOSHI (also known as Yasuhisa MIYOSHI).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: His father was Yasumitsu MIYOSHI (also known as Yasuhisa MIYOSHI).

sen.j: 母が源頼朝の乳母の妹であり、その縁で流人として伊豆国にあった頼朝に、月に3度京都の情勢を知らせていた。
sen.e: His mother was the sister of Yoritomo MINAMOTO's nanny and because of this connection, he would visit Yoritomo, who was exiled in Izu Province, three times a month to brief him on the situation in Kyoto.

His mother was the sister of Yoritomo MINAMOTO's wet nurse and he visited Yoritomo, who was exiled in Izu Province, three times a month to brief him on the situation in Kyoto because of this connection.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせ、表現を変えました。
sen.e: His mother was the sister of Yoritomo MINAMOTO's wet nurse and he visited Yoritomo, who was exiled in Izu Province, three times a month to brief him on the situation in Kyoto because of this connection.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）4月の以仁王の挙兵二ヶ月後、康信は頼朝に使者を送り、諸国に源氏追討の計画が出されているので早く奥州へ逃げるように伝えるなど、頼朝の挙兵に大きな役割を果たした（『吾妻鏡』）。
sen.e: Two months after Mochihito-o took up arms in April 1180, Yasunobu sent a messenger to Yoritomo to warn him that there was a plan to attack the MINAMOTO family members in various provinces and advised him to escape to Oshu, thereby playing an important role in the Yoritomo' uprising. ("Azuma Kagami")

Two months after Prince Mochihito took up arms in May 1180, Yasunobu sent a messenger to Yoritomo to warn him that there was a plot to attack the MINAMOTO clan members in various provinces and advised him to escape to Oshu in haste, thereby playing an important role in the Yoritomo' uprising ("Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直し、用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Two months after Prince Mochihito took up arms in May 1180, Yasunobu sent a messenger to Yoritomo to warn him that there was a plot to attack the MINAMOTO clan members in various provinces and advised him to escape to Oshu in haste, thereby playing an important role in the Yoritomo' uprising ("Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).

sen.j: 元暦元年（1184年）4月、康信は頼朝から鎌倉に呼ばれ、鶴岡八幡宮の廻廊で対面し、鎌倉に住んで武家の政務の補佐をするよう依頼されると、これを承諾した。
sen.e: In April 1184, when Yasunobu was summoned to Kamakura by Yoritomo, met him in the corridors of Tsuruoka Hachiman-gu temple, and was asked to live in Kamakura and assist in running the government affairs of the shogunate, he agreed to do so.

sen.e: In June 1184, when Yasunobu was summoned to Kamakura by Yoritomo, met him in the corridors of Tsuruoka Hachiman-gu Shrine, and was asked to live in Kamakura and assist in running the government affairs of the samurai families, he agreed to do so.

sen.e: In June 1184, when Yasunobu was summoned to Kamakura by Yoritomo, met him in the corridors of Tsuruoka Hachiman-gu Shrine, and was asked to live in Kamakura and assist in running the government affairs of the samurai families, he agreed to do so.

sen.j: （この時中宮大夫属入道善信と呼ばれている）
sen.e: (At the time he was called Chugu Daibu zoku Monk Zenshin.)

sen.j: 同年10月には貴族の家政事務をつかさどる役所の名を取った「公文所」の建物が新築された。
sen.e: In October of that year, a new building was constructed for Kobunsho, which was the name used for the bureaucracy that dealt with the household affairs of nobles.

sen.j: 大江広元がその長官となり、康信は初代問注所執事（長官）として裁判事務の責任者となった。
sen.e: Hiromoto OE became the director of the office and Yasunobu became responsible for trial affairs as the first director of Monchujo.

sen.j: 頼朝死後、2代将軍源頼家の独裁ぶりに不安を抱いた御家人の代表による十三人の合議制にも参加。
sen.e: After the death of Yoritomo, he participated in the council of 13 representatives of lower-ranking vassals, which was created out of concern of the autocratic nature of the second shogun Yoriie MINAMOTO.

After the death of Yoritomo, he participated in the council of 13 representatives of lower-ranking vassals, who were created out of concern of the autocratic nature of the second shogun MINAMOTO no Yoriie.

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）の承久の乱に際しては病身の身で会議に参加、大江広元の即時出兵論を支持した。
sen.e: In 1221, during the Jokyuno-ran Incident, he attended the council despite his illness and supported Hiromoto OE's position of immediately sending forces.
In the Jokyu War, 1221, he attended the council despite his illness and supported Hiromoto OE's position of immediately sending forces.

sen.j: 同年、承久の乱後に没した。
sen.e: He died after the Jokyuno-ran Incident in the same year.
In the same year, he died after the Jokyu War.

sen.j: 上記は『吾妻鏡』に伝える三善康信像であるが、『吾妻鏡』には三善康信の顕彰記事が相当に多く、その中には藤原定家がその日記『明月記』に書いた感想等が、あたかも三善康信の進言であるように盗作されている部分まであり、『吾妻鏡』を読むうえで相当に警戒しなければならない部分とされる。
